details.title: The Circular Synthetic Radar
details.abstract: A new type of synthetic radar, the circular synthetic radar, uses a simple interferometer whose elements are mounted at the ends of a horizontal boom rotating about a vertical mast. Pulses are radiated alternately Â¿in-phaseÂ¿ and in Â¿phase-quadrature.Â¿ The returning echoes are also detected incoherently, both Â¿in-phaseÂ¿ and in Â¿phase-quadrature.Â¿ The four distinct outputs are fed into an on-line computer which, after a Fourier analysis, synthesizes a mapping function of the azimuthal distribution of targets.
details.journal_title: IEEE Transactions on Aerospace and Electronic Systems
